title: aria-hidden on a text input
description: This test uses `aria-hidden='true'` on a div containing a text input
sr_instructions: Use the screen reader to navigate through the page
The test passes if the target input and associated label were not announced
vc_instructions: Use the VC software to activate the form control by saying "click 'your name'"
The test passes if the target form control could not be found

history.message: Sample data has been added. This data has not been verified.

output.output: Your name edit has auto complete

firefox.notes: When using focus mode (tab key) the control is still read. This is because the `aria-hidden="true"` does not make elements in the sub tree inert. It is the author's responsibility to make controls inert. See [nvaccess/nvda #5014](https://github.com/nvaccess/nvda/issues/5014) for more information.

safari.notes: When pressing tab, the hidden input does receive focus but is not announced in the traditional sense. Depending on the exact order of key-presses, VoiceOver will either announce the page title or that 'you are currently on a text field' (no label is announced). This is accurate because aria-hidden will not remove an element from the tab index.
